snippet: Quiet, religious and fiercely meticulous, President Obama’s chief of staff, Jacob J. Lew, may be the most unassuming power broker in Washington.
abstract: White House chief of staff Jacob J Lew has been entrusted by Pres Obama with guiding negotiations with Congressional Republicans to avert automatic tax increases and spending cuts on January 1, 2013; Lew is known as fierce negotiator, despite being one of most unassuming power brokers in Washington.
lead_paragraph: Quiet, religious and fiercely meticulous, President Obama’s chief of staff, Jacob J. Lew, may be the most unassuming power broker in Washington.

headline.main: Trusted Aide to Obama Faces Test in Budget Showdown
headline.print_headline: Aide to Obama Faces a Big Test In Fiscal Talks
